sentences: Andrew Roy Gibb was born on 5 March 1958 at Stretford Memorial Hospital in Stretford, Lancashire.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: He was the youngest of five children born to Barbara and Hugh Gibb.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: His mother was of Irish and English descent, and his father was of Scottish and English descent.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: He had four siblings: his sister, Lesley Evans; and three brothers—Barry and fraternal twins Robin and Maurice.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: At the age of six months, Andy Gibb emigrated with his family to Queensland, Australia, settling on Cribb Island just north of Brisbane.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: After moving several times between Brisbane and Sydney, Andy returned to the United Kingdom in January 1967 as his three older brothers began to gain international fame as the Bee Gees.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: In his childhood, his mother, Barbara, described Andy as "A little devil, a little monster.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: I'd send him off to school, but he'd sneak off to the stable and sleep with his two horses all day.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: He'd wander back home around lunchtime smelling of horse manure, yet he'd swear he had been at school.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: Oh, he was a little monkey!"Producer and film director Tom Kennedy described Andy's personality in his childhood:
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: Andy was always around—he was this cheeky little lad, Hugh and Barbara doted on him, so he would have a limo to go around London with his pals and twenty quid to go to the cinema.

sentences: But he was just a cheeky little lad with a heart of gold.

sentences: He used to try to get me to buy him beer when he was underage—he would only have been about 11 or 12.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: He quit school at the age of 13, and with an acoustic guitar given to him by his older brother Barry, he began playing at tourist clubs around Ibiza, Spain (when his parents moved there), and later on the Isle of Man, his brothers' birthplace, where his parents were living at the time.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: In June 1974, Gibb formed his first group, Melody Fayre (named after a Bee Gees song), which included Isle of Man musicians John Alderson on guitar, Stan Hughes on bass, and John Stringer on drums.
section: == Life and career == | === 1958–1975: Early life and first recordings ===

sentences: The group was managed by Andy's mother, Barbara, and had regular bookings on the small island's hotel circuit.

== Death ==

sentences: Death ==
section: == Death ==

sentences: By late January to early February in 1988, Gibb had seemingly beaten his drug addiction, regained his health, and was ready to begin recording a new album.
section: == Death ==

sentences: However, he still battled depression over his breakup with Victoria Principal.
section: == Death ==

sentences: According to Robin Gibb, his brother "just went downhill so fast...
section: == Death ==

sentences: he was in a terrible state of depression".
section: == Death ==

sentences: On 5 March 1988, Gibb celebrated his 30th birthday in London while working on the new album.
section: == Death ==

sentences: Two days after celebrating his birthday, he entered John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford complaining of chest pains.
section: == Death ==

sentences: At around 8:30 am on 10 March 1988, Gibb's doctor informed him more tests were needed to determine the cause of his chest pains.
section: == Death ==

sentences: Shortly afterward, Gibb slumped into unconsciousness and died as a result of myocarditis, an inflammation of the heart muscle caused by years of cocaine abuse that fatally weakened his heart.
section: == Death ==

sentences: This diagnosis was supported by William Shell, a cardiologist who previously treated Gibb.
section: == Death ==

sentences: With the announcement of Gibb's death, his ex-wife, Kim Reeder, was not surprised.
section: == Death ==

sentences: "I always knew that one day I'd get a call with news like this.
section: == Death ==

sentences: It was only a matter of time."
section: == Death ==

sentences: Gibb's family said the cause of death was not an overdose, as some media reports suggested, but natural causes after years of substance abuse.
section: == Death ==

sentences: Gibb's body was returned to the United States, where he was interred at Forest Lawn Memorial Park in Hollywood Hills, Los Angeles.
section: == Death ==

sentences: The headstone reads "Andy Gibb / March 5, 1958 – March 10, 1988 /

== Legacy ==

sentences: Legacy ==
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: The Andy Gibb Memorial Foundation was established to keep his name and memory alive by contributing to the charities that Gibb supported, such as the American Heart Association, the American Cancer Society, and the Diabetes Research Institute.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Following the 2003 death of their brother Maurice Gibb at Mount Sinai Medical Center & Miami Heart Institute in Miami Beach, Florida, the family asked that donations be made to the Andy Gibb Memorial Foundation in lieu of flowers.
section: == Legacy ==
